message.content:
Here's a one-week healthy meal plan that avoids your listed restrictions:

Day 1:
- Breakfast: Oatmeal with mixed berries, coconut flakes, and pumpkin seeds.
- Lunch: Quinoa salad with cucumber, bell peppers, cherry tomatoes, and a lemon vinaigrette.
- Dinner: Baked chicken breast with sauteed green beans and mashed sweet potatoes.
- Snacks: Rice cakes with natural peanut butter spread.

Day 2:
- Breakfast: Scrambled eggs with spinach, mushrooms, and whole wheat toast.
- Lunch: Tuna salad on a bed of mixed greens with cherry tomatoes and cucumber slices.
- Dinner: Baked salmon with steamed broccoli and brown rice.
- Snacks: Fresh fruit like apple or banana.

Day 3:
- Breakfast: Whole wheat pancakes with almond extract and a side of mixed fruit.
- Lunch: Shredded chicken caesar salad without croutons, using dairy-free parmesan cheese substitute.
- Dinner: Vegetable stir-fry with tofu, bell peppers, broccoli, carrots, and whole wheat noodles.
- Snacks: Carrot sticks with hummus.

Day 4:
- Breakfast: Chia seed pudding with mixed berries and coconut flakes.
- Lunch: Mixed greens salad topped with roasted chickpeas, bell peppers, and a ginger vinaigrette.
- Dinner: Turkey breast with roasted Brussels sprouts and roasted sweet potatoes.
- Snacks: Rice cakes with natural peanut butter spread.

Day 5:
- Breakfast: Avocado toast with sliced tomatoes and a side of fresh fruit.
- Lunch: Grilled chicken breast on a bed of mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, and dairy-free salad dressing.
- Dinner: Veggie burger patty made from quinoa and black beans served on whole wheat bun with lettuce, tomato, and red onion.
- Snacks: Fresh fruit like apple or banana.

Day 6:
- Breakfast: Smoothie made with frozen berries, coconut milk, and a scoop of dairy-free protein powder.
- Lunch: Dried fruit and nut mix (such as apricots, raisins, pumpkin seeds) as a snack.
- Dinner: Beef stir-fry with bell peppers, broccoli, carrots, and whole wheat rice.
- Snacks: Carrot sticks with hummus.

Day 7:
- Breakfast: Breakfast burrito filled with scrambled eggs, black beans, sauteed bell peppers, onions, and a dairy-free cheese substitute. Served with salsa on the side.
- Lunch: Baked sweet potato topped with chili, dairy-free cheddar cheese, and green onions.
- Dinner: Grilled shrimp with steamed asparagus and quinoa.
- Snacks: Rice cakes with natural peanut butter spread.

Please adjust portion sizes according to your individual caloric needs and dietary goals. Consult a registered dietitian for personalized advice.
